definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: You'll also strengthen your hip flexors and Achilles tendons.
sentences.chinese: 您還可以增強您的髖屈肌和腳腕筋腱。

sentences.english: White on the feet is desired but must not extend higher than the pasterns.
sentences.chinese: 白色足爪比較理想，但白色不能延伸到腳腕。

sentences.english: The rear pastern ( metatarsus ) is of medium length and perpendicular to the ground as the dog stands naturally.
sentences.chinese: 後腳腕長度中等，當狗自然站立時，垂直於地面。

sentences.english: Pastern is medium length and very slightly sloped.
sentences.chinese: 腳腕中等長度，非常輕微地傾斜。

sentences.english: Your ankle is badly swollen; I think the doctor ought to look at it.
sentences.chinese: 你的腳腕子腫得很厲害，我看得請醫生看看。

sentences.english: If jump when the chicken foot ankle injury, stone has been carrying her forward.
sentences.chinese: 跳傘時鳳小腳的腳腕受傷，苟金石一直揹着她前進。

sentences.english: He winced as the dog nipped his ankle.
sentences.chinese: 狗咬了他的腳腕子，疼得他齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: The dog was nipping at her ankles.
sentences.chinese: 那狗咬着她的腳腕子了。

sentences.english: I was already crying as they tied the cords round my ankles .
sentences.chinese: 當他們在我的腳腕上拴繩子的時候，我都哭出來了。

sentences.english: He swayed slightly, as if about to fall.
sentences.chinese: 她準是跌倒時把腳腕子給產歪了。

sentences.english: He hitched his pack farther over on his left shoulder, so as to take a portion of its weight from off the injured ankle.
sentences.chinese: 他把揹包向左肩挪了挪，以減輕扭傷的腳腕子的負擔。

sentences.english: I say, Bill, I've sprained my ankle .
sentences.chinese: 喂，比爾，我扭傷腳腕子啦。

definition: variant of 腳趾|脚趾[jiao3 zhi3]
to form a scar/to form a scab
triceps brachii (back of the upper arm)
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
